alert.note: Alert for Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:10PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lawrence and southwestern Wayne Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 410 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Blaine, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Louisa, Blaine, Yatesville Lake State Park, Fort Gay, Ulysses, Charley, Dunlow, Martha, Gallup, Clifford, Glenhayes, Houckville and Fallsburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
